intro: Myosotis macrocalycina, commonly known as the large-calyx forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Myosotis macrocalycina is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its hairy stems and showy flowers.
